sources.data_found: SuperPOD: 20 nodes, 8x NVIDIA A100 per node, GPU memory/GPU = 80GB. Also lists M3 and SuperPOD configurations.
M3 gpu-dev partition: 3 nodes, 8 Nvidia V100 GPUs per node. SuperPOD partitions total 20 nodes, 8 Nvidia A100s per node (18 batch + 2 short).
M3 faculty partner nodes: 1 node with NVIDIA A100 40GB; 2 nodes with dual NVIDIA V100 (4 total); 1 node with dual NVIDIA V100 (2 total); 1 node with AMD Instinct MI210 64GB.

ManeFrame II (M2, legacy): 36 accelerator nodes each with 1x NVIDIA P100; plus 3 additional nodes with 8x NVIDIA Tesla V100 each; plus 2 faculty partner nodes each with dual NVIDIA V100; also mentions 1 faculty partner node with quad NVIDIA K80.

student_data.notes: Source is SMU Registrar's Office report dated September 12, 2024 titled "Fall 2024/Fall 2023 Summary of Declared Academic Plans". In the "Lyle" school -> "Computer Science" department section (page labeled "Page 10 of 18"), Fall 2024 declared majors show: Computer Science - BA (Maj=97) and Computer Science - BS (Maj=133). undergrad_cs_count=97+133=230. Graduate (MS) declared majors: Computer Science - MS (Maj=227); the "Computer Science - MS - Onlin" row is blank (0). Doctoral declared majors: Computer Science - PhD (Maj=43). Note: this is a declared academic plans (majors/minors) headcount report; students with multiple plans could be counted in multiple rows. Pre-major CS (Computer Science - PMJ) is listed separately as Pre=148 (not included in undergrad_cs_count).

gpu_resources.notes: Cluster-by-cluster totals (nodes × GPUs_per_node): SuperPOD (current): 20×8 = 160 A100 (80GB). M3 (current) gpu-dev: 3×8 = 24 V100. M3 faculty partner nodes: (2×2)=4 V100 + (1×2)=2 V100 => +6 V100; plus (1×1)=1 A100 (40GB); plus (1×1)=1 AMD MI210 (64GB). ManeFrame II / M2 (retired, but included as a cluster found): 36×1 = 36 P100; plus 3×8 = 24 V100; plus (2×2)=4 V100 => 28 V100 on M2. Grand totals: A100 80GB=160; A100 40GB=1; V100=24+6+28=58; P100=36. K80 mentioned on M2 partner node but not requested in output fields.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
